column4: A little off-topic, what should be my next distro after i've "re-learned" Linux? I installed this so it would be easier for me to learn.
well re-learned as in, gained a little proficiency
or Ubuntu is "the one"
Mostly dev work only. c/c++/html/Java
Noone recommended Debian :) heh
But yeah i did hear about Arch, i got to take a look into it :)
that's what i want :)
No harm in VM'ing it and trying Fedora/Arch.
ofcourse in a month or so :)
if your a c++ programer you might like gento http://www.gentoo.org/
will look into that too.
it's probly not what you want but to monitor my network I use cacti ,  cacti will also monitor mem usage and a few other things on my local system but I also use it to monitor remote system usage
any recommendation is good, let me look into it.
you were right, that's not what i need but a very useful tool indeed for remote system monitoring.
ya it's graphics are cool you can zoom in and out from 5 minits to 2 years ago
I use it to monitor network bandwidth at different points on my net so I can tell what is using what bandwidth and how long something didn't work
I do a search in synaptic for undel and I see three packages that might work but I've never tried them recover, maicrescue, e2undel
it wasn't me looking for it, to be honest. I wanted to know if it's possible. It was s7r who wanted to know.
and he quit.
sorry I don't look back far enuf
no apologies. I don't like them. By you mentioning all those undelete utilities in the channel, you probably helped someone who might use it.
heck yeah tons of them on NTFS
